Failed to create a USDC deposit account.
Code is a crypto wallet app that makes it simple to use the cryptocurrency Kin.
As a not-for-profit organization all the money we make is reinvested into achieving our mission of making crypto simple to use. Your support is appreciated.
For the more technically inclined you can visit the Technical FAQ.
Kin is a cryptocurrency like Bitcoin, only optimized for small, everyday transactions.
Your Kin is stored on the Solana blockchain. Only your Access Key can be used to access it.
Kin is like cash. The only way to get it back is for them to give it back.
No there arenâ€™t. Exchange rates are updated in real time and no fees are added.
The simplest way to buy Kin is from a friend who already has Code. You can also find other ways at reddit.com/r/buykin
Yes you can. Kin can be sold on cryptocurrency exchanges. If you need help ask a friend who knows crypto.
Similar to other cryptocurrencies the value of Kin is based on supply and demand. So if more people buy Kin the value increases, and if more people sell Kin the value decreases.
Code is a not-for-profit organization that plans to sustain itself through an upcoming subscription model, similar to what apps like Signal and Twitter do.
What does Code do with the money it makes?
What if I want to learn more about how exactly Code works?
What if I accidentally give someone Kin?
Are there any fees when using different currencies?
How do I buy more Kin?
Why does the value of Kin change?
